results.title: Raoul Wallenberg: between the lines [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Karin Altmann, Bob Weis and Jethro Films Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The story of Raoul Wallenberg, a Swedish diplomat living in wartime Budapest who displayed outstanding courage and ingenuity in rescuing Jews from the holocaust. An edited version of the 80 minute feature length documentary.

results.title: In between
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Mandy Smith and Kim Dalton
results.brief_description: A mini series of four one-hour episodes, each of which concentrates primarly on one of the four major characters (Fatima, Saret, Angie and Alex) but also, advances the stories of three other characters. We learn of their relationships with friends and neighbours,their families and their workplaces.

results.title: Jane Eyre
results.creator_credit: Julian Amyes, Barry Letts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Featuring Timothy Dalton and Zelah Clarke, Jane Eyre leaves a charitable institution to work for the mysterious Mr. Rochester. Thornfield is a house of many secrets and Jane embark’s on a journey of self discovery, where not only her values, but her chances of finding love and happiness, are threatened. Based on the novel by Charlotte Bronte.

results.title: Educating Rita
results.creator_credit: Lewis Gilbert, Acorn Films and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the play of the same name by Willy Russell. Frank, a cynical and drunken professor of literature is appalled and then amused by the quest for knowledge and culture of one of his new students, a hairdresser named Rita. Frank soon finds that Rita has more zest for life and more natural intelligence than most of his “educated students”. Features Michael Caine and Julie Walters.

results.title: Jailhouse rock
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The story of a hard-working young man, jailed for manslaughter, finds an outlet for his frustrations in music, and eventually becomes a rock star. Considered to be Elvis Presley’s best film performance “Jailhouse Rock” features many songs by Jerry Liebler and Mike Stollen, including “Jailhouse Rock”, “Treat Me Nice”, and “Baby I Don’t Care”.

results.title: Peter Principle: jumping for jelly beans, etc.
results.brief_description: Peter Principle. Dr. Peter offers his disturbing insight into why people get promoted to their level of competence. Why people struggle up the hierarchy of an organization when it is no good for neither them or the company? “Jumping Jelly Beans” Professor Fred Hezberges name is associated with the study of motivation. Here he delivers his theories in a stimulating lecture. “Up the organization”. Robert Townsend expounds his radical philosophy on the subject of running a business. No department is safe from his challenging and witty criticism.

results.title: Maths for the 21st century
results.brief_description: This video says all the right things about maths and is entirely consistent with Frameworks. It has a Queensland focus (Teachers are a little passive compared to Victoria and the workshop style of Calvin Irons is certainly different). However, it should be a useful stimulus film for schools conducting their own self-help stimulus programs. The first sessions could be run over 5 weeks, hence its impact could develop as teachers progressively engage the ideas. No other credits available.

results.title: No labels for Annie
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: A portrait of Annette Duras, a young woman whose life has become enriched and meaningful since obtaining a job in “open employment”. The program highlights the need for us to resist categorising others with destructive labels and illustrates the positive effect on people when labels are discarded.

results.title: Zoo Dance
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Dance movement programme operates at the Royal Melbourne Zoo. Its aims include encouraging creativity and communication between students and teachers, self-expression, building self confidence. Available to children with disabilities as well as the regular school student.
